title: Riot should bring back High elo Spectating.
body: Alright. so don't get me wrong. this Isn't a hateful post at all. infact i love riot. but I'm sure we should remember the feature riot use to have that Allowed you to spectate high elo games at the bottom right of your screen. I have no idea why riot removed this but i think it is a great feature. People who are new to the game can find that a way as A) Seeing high elo gameplay B) learn about a champion, and C) overall Observations. This helped me when i was new set a goal for my rank and learn about my main at the time Katarina. I feel as if new players of now should still be filled with the excitement of scrolling through and seeing a high elo summoner playing as their character. My moral is i think riot should bring that feature back. What do you think?

Posted a few months ago:

You can actually get it back! I can't take credit for this, but after months of being frustrated about this, I checked to see if someone had found a solution, and I found this Reddit post:
https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4rhymk/what_happened_to_the_spectate_high_elo_players/

Instructions:

Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client_config_na\releases\0.0.0.58\deploy\ and find the file called "lol.properties" (This is a text file, so open it with a text editor. You will need to adjust your folder path depending on install location or version changes.)

Find this line:
lobbyLandingURL=https://frontpage.na.leagueoflegends.com/$localeCode/client/landing

Change it to:
lobbyLandingURL=

Save the file. (It's also a good idea to save a backup of the original in case you wish to revert easily.)

What the client seems to do is load a webpage onto the main client page. When you remove this URL, the client will show a different layout, and the Spectate Live section will be on the upper left of the main page.

Since this change is just preventing a page from loading (You could also possibly just block this with your firewall instead of altering the file, but I haven't tested this.), I don't believe that this is against Riot's terms of service, and they're still providing the old spectate functionality. This doesn't change the in-game files in any way.

Again, I can't take credit for this, but let your friends know that they can spectate again if they wish!

I was a very new under level 30 player in late 2015. I really loved watching high elo people play the game. It was exciting and I felt like there were so many great things for me to learn.

I loved it when I started to play. I often spectated them playing and at first I thought it was just random games. It took me a while to notice it were games of the best players. It may not be as educating as watching pro streams, but it's interesting on its own. You can actually spectate good player, analyze the game play without some streamer talking or trolling and stuff. 
I think it's a feature that should be brought back.
Sometimes I just didn't want to play a game of League, but I would just watch a bunch of high elo matches. It was an epic way to watch games without needing to use lolnexus or whatever.
My memory is hazy, but I think the reason they took it away was that some high elo players complained they were losing potential viewers from their streams.
but wouldnt that actually increase their viewers?
no, because the people aren't watching it on the streams but rather the client so they don't get that viewer count.

To further explain, advertising revenue is based on how many people on Twitch are watching, not how many see the actual games. An argument could be made that you would discover new streamers from the old system but seeing as how a lot of them get discovered on their own or get into pro league they don't need the small bit of name recognition.
also the whole reason I discovered some streamers was by seeing there names in High elo Spectating and then going out to find them myself on twitch!

> There aren't any plans currently to bring exactly that feature back. We removed it from Home in the legacy client when we upgraded to requiring HTTPS for all content we display (out of a desire to keep you more secure). We also saw very low engagement with the feature, and in general it didn't align very closely with any specific intent.

> If we were to build a replacement in the future, it would probably provide better controls over which games you could spectate (champions, matchups, level of play, things like that).
